title.narrative: Strengthening Health Systems in Borana

description.narrative: Developing and designing a feasible and locally owned/supported PBF (Performance Based Financing) pilot in one of the districts of the Borana zone of Ethiopia. As much as possible the PBF tasks division (regulation, internal & counter verification, community verification, provision of services, purchasing, fund holding, clients) should build on available structures/institutions/organizations. Also the incorporation of community participation is important.

Ethiopian national maternal mortality rate 350/100T (2010) and under 5 mortality rate 88/1000. Together with the Regional Health Bureau of Oromia, Cordaid intends to pilot a PBF scheme in 2 districts in the Borena Zone of the Oromya Region. The Oromyia Regional Health Bureau and the Zonal Health Bureau have shown interest to pilot a PBF (Performance Based Financing)scheme supported by Cordaid. If successful, this pilot could be scaled up to other districts in the region. The WB supports the FMOH with a Program for Results. This Program is focusing on the national level (Cash on delivery) and does not have direct repercussions for the health facilities. PBF is an approach that seeks to strengthen health systems and health facilities directly. The government is currently embarking on a social health insurance program and a community health insurance program
Final beneficiary is the population of Yabello Town (23,531 inhabitants) and Yabello rural (102,337 inhabitants), for a total population of 125,918 inhabitants.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
